election_record.label: New York 1807 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The official canvass of votes lists 35848 votes for John Broome and 30327 votes for Thomas Storm in New York, though the district totals add up to 35847 votes for John Broome and 30318 votes for Thomas Storm.

sub_unit.name: Eastern
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes as listed in the American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, lists 9129 votes for John Broome in the Eastern District, though the county totals add up to 9127.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, lists 48 votes for John Broome in Ward 2 of Albany.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 49 votes for John Broome and 74 votes for Thomas Storm in Ward 3 of Albany.

sub_unit.name: Four
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 16 votes for John Broome and 89 votes for Thomas Storm in Ward 4 of Albany.

sub_unit.name: Chazy
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, lists 29 votes for Thomas Storm in Chazy.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 7, lists 1495 votes for Thomas Storm in Hoosick.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 132 votes for John Broome in Brunswick.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 59 votes for Thomas Storm in Grafton.

sub_unit.name: Greenbush
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, lists 104 votes for John Broome in Greenbush.

sub_unit.name: Philipstown
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 7, The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 8, and the Northern Budget, May 5, list 168 votes for Thomas Storm in Philipstown.

sub_unit.name: Schodack
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 7, lists 111 votes for Thomas Storm in Schodack.
The Northern Budget, May 12, lists 133 votes for John Broome in Schodack.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes lists 1765 votes for John Broome in Saratoga county, though the town totals listed add up to 1763.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 1753 votes for John Broome in Saratoga county.

sub_unit.name: Ballston
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 101 votes for Thomas Storm in Ballston.

sub_unit.name: Charlton
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 120 votes for John Broome in Charlton.

sub_unit.name: Greenfield
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 170 votes for John Broome in Greenfield.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), May 26, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 143 votes for John Broome in Saratoga.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes as listed in The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 2009 votes for John Broome in Washington county.

sub_unit.name: Easton
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes as listed in The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 122 votes for John Broome in Easton.

sub_unit.name: Middle
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes as listed in the American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, lists 7350 votes for Thomas Storm in the Middle District, though the county totals add up to 7352.

sub_unit.name: Granger
sub_unit.note: All newspaper sources for Columbia county list 78 votes for Thomas Storm in Granger, though the original election returns list 75 votes.

sub_unit.name: Hillsdale
sub_unit.note: All newspaper sources for Columbia county list 285 votes for John Broome and 175 votes for Thomas Storm in Hillsdale, though the original election returns list 292 for Broome and 168 votes for Storm.

sub_unit.name: Kinderhook
sub_unit.note: All newspaper sources for Columbia county list 141 votes for John Broome in Kinderhook, though the original election returns list 142 votes.

sub_unit.name: Colchester
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists no votes for John Broome in Colchester.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes and The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 978 votes for Thomas Storm in Orange county, though the town totals listed add up to 980.
The Political Index, May 7, lists 988 votes for Thomas Storm in Orange county.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 253 votes for Thomas Storm in Montgomery.

sub_unit.name: New Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 47 votes for Thomas Storm in New Windsor.

sub_unit.name: Rockland
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 6, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 6, list 167 votes for Thomas Storm in Rockland.

sub_unit.name: Haverstraw
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 69 votes for Thomas Storm in Haverstraw.

sub_unit.name: Hempstead
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 6, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 6, list 23 votes for Thomas Storm in Hempstead.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 16; American Citizen (New York, NY), May 12; The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 12; The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 11; and New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 15, list 1273 votes for Thomas Storm in Ulster county.

sub_unit.name: Lumberland
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 16; and New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 15, list 27 votes for Thomas Storm in Lumberland.

sub_unit.name: Shawangunk
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 16; and New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 15, list 113 votes for Thomas Storm in Shawangunk.

sub_unit.name: Southern
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes lists 5701 votes for John Broome and 3873 votes for Thomas Storm in the Southern District, though the county totals add up to 5697 votes for John Broome and 3862 votes for Thomas Storm.

sub_unit.name: New York
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes lists 1676 votes for John Broome in New York City, though the ward totals listed add up to 1672.
The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, lists 1696 votes for John Broome in New York City.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 139 votes for John Broome in Ward 2 of New York City.

sub_unit.name: Six
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, and The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, list 201 votes for John Broome in Ward 6 of New York City.

sub_unit.name: Eight
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 185 votes for John Broome in Ward 8 of New York City.
The True American, May 6, lists 116 votes for Thomas Storm in Ward 8.

sub_unit.name: Queens
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 11; The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 4; Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 5; and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 4 list 759 votes for John Broome in Queens county.

sub_unit.name: Oyster Bay
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 11; The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 4; Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 5; American Citizen (New York, NY), May 4; and "Queens County in Olden Times" list 155 votes for John Broome in Oyster Bay.

sub_unit.name: Richmond
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 2, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 2, list 245 votes for Thomas Storm in Richmond county.

sub_unit.name: Northfield
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 2, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 2, list 47 votes for Thomas Storm in Northfield.

sub_unit.name: Suffolk
sub_unit.note: The Suffolk Gazette (Sag Harbor, NY), May 18, lists 1641 votes for John Broome in Suffolk county.

sub_unit.name: Easthampton
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19, and the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 16, list 177 votes for John Broome in Easthampton.

sub_unit.name: Shelter Island
sub_unit.note: The Suffolk Gazette (Sag Harbor, NY), May 18, lists 20 votes for John Broome in Shelter Island.
The Public Advertiser (New York, NY), May 7 and 14, list 20 votes for John Broome and 1 vote for Thomas Storm in Shelter Island

sub_unit.name: Westchester
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes lists 829 votes for Thomas Storm in Westchester county, though the town totals listed add up to 818.

sub_unit.name: Yorktown
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 19, list no votes for Thomas Storm in Yorktown.

sub_unit.name: Western
sub_unit.note: John Broom received 2 votes as John Broon.

The official canvass of votes as listed in the American Citizen (New York, NY), June 12, and the Columbian Gazette, June 16, lists 14759 votes for John Broome in the Western District, though the county totals add up to 14764.

sub_unit.name: Angelica
sub_unit.note: Angelica was the only town in Allegany County in 1807.

sub_unit.name: Stonington
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 26 votes for Thomas Storm in Stonington.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23; Columbian Gazette, May 12; New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20; and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 18, list 625 votes for Thomas Storm in Herkimer county.

sub_unit.name: German Flatts
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19, and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 18, list 38 votes for Thomas Storm in German Flatts.

sub_unit.name: Herkimer
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 19, and American Citizen (New York, NY), May 18, list 90 votes for Thomas Storm in the town of Herkimer.

sub_unit.name: Jefferson
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 22, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21 and 26, list 808 votes for John Broome and 558 votes for Thomas Storm in Jefferson county.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 801 votes for John Broome and 558 votes for Thomas Storm in Jefferson county.

sub_unit.name: Champion
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 36 votes for John Broome in Champion.

sub_unit.name: Henderson
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 26 votes for John Broome in Henderson.

sub_unit.name: Le Ray
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 87 votes for John Broome in Le Ray.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: John Broome received 1 vote as John Broon.

sub_unit.name: Florence
sub_unit.note: The Patriot, May 12, lists 25 votes for John Broome and 27 votes for Thomas Storm in Florence.

sub_unit.name: Steuben
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 12; New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23; and the New-York Evening Post (New York, NY), May 20, list 40 votes for Thomas Storm in Steuben.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 22 and 26; the New-York Herald (New York, NY), May 23; the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 29; the Columbian Gazette, May 12; and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 2, list 1053 votes for Thomas Storm in Onondaga county.

sub_unit.name: Otisco
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 22, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 29, list 79 votes for Thomas Storm in Otisco.

sub_unit.name: Hartford
sub_unit.note: "The votes taken in the town of Hartford, in this county [Ontario] were rejected, it appearing that the poll of the election had been kept open four days." Abany Register, May 22 and June 12, 1807. These votes have here been credited to their intended candidates.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), June 12, lists 91 votes for John Broome in Lincoln.

sub_unit.name: Saint Lawrence
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 22, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21 and 26, list 169 votes for John Broome in Saint Lawrence county.
The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 120 votes for John Broome in Saint Lawrence.

sub_unit.name: Canton
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list no votes for John Broome in Canton.

sub_unit.name: De Kalb
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list 1 vote for John Broome in De Kalb.

sub_unit.name: Lisbon
sub_unit.note: The American Citizen (New York, NY), June 9, and the Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), June 12, list no votes for John Broome in Lisbon.

sub_unit.name: Middleburgh
sub_unit.note: "The votes taken in the town of Middleburgh in Schoharie County were rejected, the inspectors not having mentioned in their certificate any office that they were listed for." The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 22 and June 12, 1807.

sub_unit.name: Seneca
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 21, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 21, list 205 votes for Thomas Storm in Seneca county.

sub_unit.name: Tioga
sub_unit.note: The official canvass of votes lists 162 votes for John Broome in Broome county, though the town totals listed add up to 167.

sub_unit.name: Spencer
sub_unit.note: The Public Advertiser (New York, NY) lists 65 votes for John Broome in Spencer.
